<!-- To import this information into a WordPress blog follow these steps. -->
<!-- 1. Log in to that blog as an administrator. -->
<!-- 2. Go to Tools: Import in the blog's admin panels (or Manage: Import in older versions of WordPress). -->
<!-- 3. Choose "WordPress" from the list. -->
<!-- 4. Upload this file using the form provided on that page. -->
<!-- 5. You will first be asked to map the authors in this export file to users -->
<!--    on the blog.  For each author, you may choose to map to an -->
<!--    existing user on the blog or to create a new user -->
<!-- 6. WordPress will then import each of the posts, comments, and categories -->
<!--    contained in this file into your blog -->

		<item>
		<title>Zend Framework - Working with Modules</title>
		<link>http://koshaked.wordpress.com/?p=79</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 30 Nov -0001 00:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Shaked]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Uncategorized]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="uncategorized"><![CDATA[Uncategorized]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://koshaked.wordpress.com/?p=79</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<ol>
	<li>Modules are very important, fully power and useful tool. Its helps us to create mini-application inside our application so we will be able to use it when ever we want. We will get back into it later. First I want to start with <em><strong>BaseX.</strong></em></li>
	<li>One approach that I like is using our own base files, this actually means you will have some kind of manager for each class, like controller, model or any other core files. We will create Sko_Base_Controller (We will talk about naming convention in the near future) and Sko_Base_Model. Same we will use for Unit testing though I guess I will write about it on my next post.</li>
	<li>Base controller should contain everything we need to manage our controllers. Sometime we need unique things for our project that can't be inside ZF core but we need them for (almost) every controller.</li>
</ol>
<div><strong>Modules [<del>Notice that I`ve started BaseX and continue with Modules</del>) </strong></div>
<div>While creating  modules you need to know few things which will help you to start fast. <strong>
</strong></div>
<ol>
<ol>
	<li>For creating new module with <em>zf</em> tool, use the following command:<strong> <em>zf create module name</em></strong>, e.g: zf create module Users.
<strong>Note</strong>: Before using this command, you will have to be on your project (ZF) directory, e.g: <strong><em>cd /var/www/html/skoproject/ | zf create module Users</em></strong></li>
	<li>Know your enemy ;). Its important to know modules folder structure which you can see <a title="Modules folder structure" href="http://framework.zend.com/manual/zh/zend.loader.autoloader-resource.html#zend.loader.autoloader-resource.module" target="_blank">here</a> and you will have to know that you can use controllers/ folder as well, full folder structure will be:
<ul>
	<li>forms/</li>
	<li>models/</li>
<ul>
	<li>DbTable/</li>
	<li>mappers/</li>
</ul>
	<li>plugins/</li>
	<li>services/</li>
	<li>views/</li>
<ul>
	<li>helpers/</li>
	<li>filters/</li>
</ul>
	<li>controllers/</li>
	<li>Bootstrap.php</li>
</ul>
</li>
	<li>After creating your module and your desired directory structure, you will have to update your main <em><strong>Bootstrap.php</strong></em>(<strong><em>/path/to/project/application/Bootstrap.php</em></strong>) to know your module(s):<em>protected function _initAppModules(){</em>
<em>//Don't forget to bootstrap the front controller as the resource may not been created yet...</em>
<em>    $this-&gt;bootstrap("frontController");</em>
<em>    $front = $this-&gt;getResource("frontController");</em>
<em>/*adding modules dir to defult route,       see: <a href="http://framework.zend.com/manual/1.11/en/zend.controller.modular.html#zend.controller.modular.directories">http://framework.zend.com/manual/1.11/en/zend.controller.modular.html#zend.controller.modular.directories</a></em>
<em>*/</em>
<em>    $front-&gt;addModuleDirectory(APPLICATION_PATH . '/modules');</em>
<em>}</em></li>
</ol>
</ol>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Zend Framework and Smarty integration - #2</title>
		<link>http://koshaked.wordpress.com/?p=69</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 30 Nov -0001 00:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Shaked]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Dev]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="dev"><![CDATA[Dev]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[PHP]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="php"><![CDATA[PHP]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Zend Framework]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="zend-framework"><![CDATA[Zend Framework]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://koshaked.wordpress.com/?p=69</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[So after you saw my <a href="link">previous post</a> about how to create new ZF project I want to show you how to integrate with Smarty template engine. I don't really like templating system because  sometimes its kind of overkill for your front hand developer, but still you need to know how to use it.
<ol>
	<li>Error message with Smarty - &lt;?php ?&gt; - aren't allowed. {PHOTO}</li>
	<li><a href="http://forums.zend.com/viewtopic.php?f=69&amp;t=998">http://forums.zend.com/viewtopic.php?f=69&amp;t=998</a></li>
	<li>autoloader <a href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2151773/zend-framework-autoloading-a-class-library">http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2151773/zend-framework-autoloading-a-class-library</a></li>
	<li><a href="http://www.gediminasm.org/article/smarty-3-extension-for-zend-framework">http://www.gediminasm.org/article/smarty-3-extension-for-zend-framework</a></li>
	<li>layouts</li>
	<li>zf tool fix for smarty enable\disable</li>
	<li>ajax <a href="http://my.opera.com/zomg/blog/2007/10/26/handling-ajax-requests-in-the-zend-framework">http://my.opera.com/zomg/blog/2007/10/26/handling-ajax-requests-in-the-zend-framework</a></li>
	<li>bug <a href="http://framework.zend.com/issues/browse/ZF-10569">http://framework.zend.com/issues/browse/ZF-10569</a></li>
</ol>
<div><a href="http://roysimkes.net/blog/2010/06/creating-and-managing-zend-framework-modules/">http://roysimkes.net/blog/2010/06/creating-and-managing-zend-framework-modules/</a></div>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Auto Draft</title>
		<link>http://koshaked.wordpress.com/?p=85</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 30 Nov -0001 00:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Shaked]]></dc:creator>
		
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://koshaked.wordpress.com/?p=85</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>85</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2011-05-18 18:40:34</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>0000-00-00 00:00:00</wp:post_date_gmt>

		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
							</item>
		<item>
		<title>Fedora Core 14 - 64 Bit - Asus N53J - installation &amp; configuration #2</title>
		<link>http://koshaked.wordpress.com/2011/05/04/fedora-core-14-64-bit-asus-n53j-installation-configuration-2/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 04 May 2011 19:49:42 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Shaked]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Asus N53J]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="asus-n53j"><![CDATA[Asus N53J]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Fedora]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="fedora"><![CDATA[Fedora]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Fedora]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="fedora"><![CDATA[Fedora]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Fedora Core]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="fedora-core"><![CDATA[Fedora Core]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Hibernate]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="hibernate"><![CDATA[Hibernate]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Linux]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="linux"><![CDATA[Linux]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Linux]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="linux"><![CDATA[Linux]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Problem]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="problem"><![CDATA[Problem]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Sleep]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="sleep"><![CDATA[Sleep]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://koshaked.wordpress.com/?p=16</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[So last time I wrote about Fedora configuration issues, I mentioned Suspend &amp; Hibernate problems. I searched all over google and ask about those issues via IRC (#Fedora on freenode), they told me that this is a known issue and there is not much to do for now. I really trust those guys, but I was sure that I could find a solution for this issue, at least one of them.

After -very- long googling, I found the following solution <a href="http://thecodecentral.com/2011/01/18/fix-ubuntu-10-10-suspendhibernate-not-working-bug#header-0">Here</a>.
<ul>
	<li style="color:red;"><strong>Notice that this solution has been written for Ubuntu on Asus laptops.</strong></li>
	<li style="color:red;"><strong>This solution worked for me only for Suspend mode, Hibernate mode Doesn't work (yet). </strong></li>
</ul>
<strong>Step 1</strong>:

<code>
Create a script under /etc/pm/sleep.d/. It can be any name, but to ensure the load order, use the prefix 20_.
sudo gedit /etc/pm/sleep.d/20_custom-ehci_hcd &amp;
</code>
<!--more-->
<strong>Step 2</strong>:

Insert this into 20_custon-ehci_hcd
<code></code>

#!/bin/sh

TMPLIST_E=/tmp/ehci-dev-list
TMPLIST_X=/tmp/xhci-dev-list
E_DIR=/sys/bus/pci/drivers/ehci_hcd
X_DIR=/sys/bus/pci/drivers/xhci_hcd
E_BIND=$E_DIR""/bind
E_UNBIND=$E_DIR""/unbind
X_BIND=$X_DIR""/bind
X_UNBIND=$X_DIR""/unbind

#param1 = temp file, param2 = device dir, param3 = unbind
unbindDev (){
#inspired by http://art.ubuntuforums.org/showpost.php?p=9744970&amp;postcount=19
echo -n '' &gt; $1
for i in `ls $2 | egrep '[0-9a-z]+\:[0-9a-z]+\:.*$'`; do
echo -n "$i" | tee $3
echo "$i" &gt;&gt; $1
done
}

#param1 = tem file, param2 = bind
bindDev(){
[ -f $1 ] || return

for i in `cat $1`; do
echo -n "$i" | tee $2

done
rm $1
}

case "${1}" in
hibernate|suspend)
unbindDev $TMPLIST_E $E_DIR $E_UNBIND
unbindDev $TMPLIST_X $X_DIR $X_UNBIND
;;
resume|thaw)
bindDev $TMPLIST_E $E_BIND
bindDev $TMPLIST_X $X_BIND
;;
esac

<strong>Step 3</strong>:
Add executable permission:

<code>
sudo chmod 755 /etc/pm/sleep.d/20_custom-ehci_hcd
</code>

<strong>Result</strong>
<code>
Your suspend/hibernate mode should work now as expected.
Suggestions on improving this script are welcome on <a href="http://thecodecentral.com/2011/01/18/fix-ubuntu-10-10-suspendhibernate-not-working-bug/comment-page-2">http://thecodecentral.com/2011/01/18/fix-ubuntu-10-10-suspendhibernate-not-working-bug/comment-page-2</a>.
You may leave your comments here as well. </code>

Have fun !]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		</wp:postmeta>

		<item>
		<title>Installing Jira on Ubuntu server</title>
		<link>http://koshaked.wordpress.com/2011/05/10/installing-jira-on-ubuntu-server/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 10 May 2011 21:11:43 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Shaked]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[JIRA]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="jira"><![CDATA[JIRA]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[jira]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="jira-2"><![CDATA[jira]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Linux]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="linux"><![CDATA[Linux]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Ubuntu]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="ubuntu"><![CDATA[Ubuntu]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[ubuntu server]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="ubuntu-server"><![CDATA[ubuntu server]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://koshaked.wordpress.com/?p=46</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Hey,

Couple a days ago I tried to install <a title="Jira" href="http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/" target="_blank">Jira</a>. There are few important things that you need to remember behind the <a title="Installation guide (Linux)" href="http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Installing+JIRA+Standalone+on+Unix+or+Linux" target="_blank">installation guide</a>.
<ul>
	<li>Jira works by default with port 8080, but you can <a title="Changing Jira's default port" href="http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Changing+JIRA+Standalone%27s+port" target="_blank">change it</a></li>
	<li>Port 8080 must be opened in your router for remote connections (<a title="Port forwarding" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Port_forwarding" target="_blank">Port forwarding</a>)</li>
	<li>Validate that Jira is listening on the right port by using "netstat -and | grep 8080"</li>
</ul>
<div>After finishing installation you will be able to remote connect JIRA by using the following URL:</div>
<div>          http://IP:8080</div>
<div>Few more issues:</div>
<div>
<ul>
	<li>When using SSL connection for JIRA Mail Server you will have to use JNDI. Please see <a title="Using Gmail as a JIRA Mail Server" href="http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Using+Gmail+as+a+JIRA+Mail+Server" target="_blank">here</a>.</li>
	<li>When you are seeing 404 page with the following message: "<em>description The requested resource () is not available. smtp</em>" you have to check 2 things:</li>
</ul>
<div>
<ol>
	<li>Remove lock file from JIRA_INSTALLED_PATH/.<em>jira</em>-home.<em>lock (rm -rf .jira-home.lock)</em></li>
	<li>Remove DB lock, filename: jiradb.lck which you may find in <em>JIRA_HOME/database/jiradb.lck </em></li>
	<li>Before you stop &amp; start JIRA server I will advice to check your process (ps -f) seems that JIRA log keep working after you stop JIRA.</li>
</ol>
<div>starting JIRA: JIRA_HOME/bin/start-jira.sh</div>
<div>stoping JIRA: JIRA_HOME/bin/stop-jira.sh</div>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div>I will probably add more information in the future, when I will meet new problems that I think you should know about.</div><br />
<div>If you'll have any suggestion or problems you are welcome to write your comments or try #atlassian on irc.freenode.org.</div>
<div>--Shaked.</div>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Commands</title>
		<link>http://koshaked.wordpress.com/commands/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2011 15:41:19 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Shaked]]></dc:creator>
		
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://koshaked.wordpress.com/?page_id=59</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>59</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2011-05-13 17:41:19</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2011-05-13 15:41:19</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>commands</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>trash</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>page</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
								<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>_edit_last</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[22477560]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
				<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>_edit_lock</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1305301279:22477560]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
				<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>_wp_trash_meta_status</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[draft]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
				<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>_wp_trash_meta_time</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1305301407]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>

		<item>
		<title>How to set your gmail business account on pidgin</title>
		<link>http://koshaked.wordpress.com/?p=74</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 15 May 2011 01:42:54 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Shaked]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[gmail chat]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="gmail-chat"><![CDATA[gmail chat]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[google business chat]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="google-business-chat"><![CDATA[google business chat]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[google chat]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="google-chat"><![CDATA[google chat]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[gtalk]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="gtalk"><![CDATA[gtalk]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Pidgin]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="pidgin"><![CDATA[Pidgin]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://koshaked.wordpress.com/?p=74</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>1. Set your username without the @ sign.<br>
2. Set your domain and delete gmail.com <br>
3. Go to advanced tab and add the chat server talk.google.com</p>
<p>Sign in.</p>
<p>  </p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>74</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2011-05-15 03:42:54</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2011-05-15 01:42:54</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>draft</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
							</item>
		<item>
		<title>Installing &amp; Creating Zend framework project with zf tool</title>
		<link>http://koshaked.wordpress.com/2011/05/18/installing-creating-zend-framework-project-with-zf-tool/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 18 May 2011 07:12:47 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Shaked]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Dev]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="dev"><![CDATA[Dev]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[PHP]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="php"><![CDATA[PHP]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[PHP]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="php"><![CDATA[PHP]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Zend Framework]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="zend-framework"><![CDATA[Zend Framework]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[Zend Framwork]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="zend-framwork"><![CDATA[Zend Framwork]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[zf]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="zf"><![CDATA[zf]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://koshaked.wordpress.com/?p=53</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[OK so I think I want to make it much clear from other guides that I found. So lets just get started:
<ol>
	<li>Open your command line (on windows use <em><strong>cmd</strong>, </em>on linux use your <em><strong>terminal</strong></em>). <span style="text-decoration:underline;"><strong>Note:</strong></span> don't forget that you need web server. you can make it by <a title="Mine is from Rami's repository " href="http://blog.famillecollet.com/pages/Config-en" target="_blank">your self</a> or use <a title="WAMP for Windows" href="http://www.wampserver.com/en/download.php" target="_blank">WAMP</a> (Windows), <a title="LAMP for Linux" href="http://www.ghacks.net/2009/07/23/how-to-install-a-lamp-server/" target="_blank">LAMP</a> (Linux) or <a title="MAMP for Mac" href="http://www.mamp.info/en/downloads/index.html" target="_blank">MAMP</a> (Mac).</li>
	<li>There are few ways to install Zend Framework:</li>
<ul>
	<li>Download as a Linux distribution package:</li>
<ul>
	<li><strong><em>sudo aptitude install zendframework </em></strong></li>
	<li><strong><em>sudo apt-get install zendframework </em></strong></li>
	<li><strong><em>sudo yum install zendframework </em></strong>[As far as I know, <a title="Remi's repository " href="http://blog.famillecollet.com/pages/Config-en" target="_blank">Remi's repository</a> is up-to-date]</li>
</ul>
	<li>You may install Zend Framework by your self, which is good practice, though you don't have to.</li>
<ul>
	<li>First <a title="Zend Framework latest version" href="http://www.zend.com/community/downloads" target="_blank">download Zend Framework</a></li>
	<li>Unpack tar.gz \ zip</li>
	<li>Add your Zend Framework library to OS's PATH. [<a title="Set your PATH on Windows 7" href="http://geekswithblogs.net/renso/archive/2009/10/21/how-to-set-the-windows-path-in-windows-7.aspx" target="_blank">Windows</a> \ <a title="Set your PATH on Linux" href="http://www.linuxquestions.org/questions/linux-newbie-8/how-to-set-path-how-do-i-set-path-environment-variable-111204/" target="_blank">Linux</a>]</li>
	<li>My recommendation is to copy Zend Framework library to your PHP library</li>
	<li>Add Zend Framework to <strong><em>include_path</em></strong> on <strong>php.ini</strong> [When adding your path note path's slash. On Windows use "\" and on Linux use "/"]. <a title="About Zend Framework and include_path" href="http://devzone.zend.com/article/4683" target="_blank">Read more about ZF &amp; include_path</a></li>
	<li>If you have problems with ZF tool, please <a title="ZF tool" href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2088848/zend-tool-include-path" target="_blank">read this</a></li>
</ul>
</ul>
	<li>Lets create our project: <em><strong>zf create project /path/to/project/ [NAME-OF-PROFILE] [FILE-OF-PROFILE]</strong></em>. Our project will be skoproject: zf create project /var/www/html/<span style="text-decoration:underline;"><strong>skoproject</strong></span>/ skoproject</li>
	<li>Its very important to remember that you need to add "<span style="text-decoration:underline;"><strong>PROJECTNAME</strong></span>" to your path. if you forget and then you'll try to create another project you may see the following error msg:
<pre> 
 An Error Has Occurred
 A project already exists here
<a href="http://koshaked.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/zfcreateprojectexisterror.png"><img class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-56" title="zfcreateprojectexisterror" src="http://koshaked.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/zfcreateprojectexisterror.png?w=300" alt="zf create project error while project is already exists." width="300" height="62" /></a></pre>
If you want to fix this problem, you'll have to remove <em>.zfproject.xml.</em> You can find this file by using <em><strong>find /path/to/project -name '.zfproject.xml' </strong></em>and then delete it with <strong><em> rm -rf /path/to/project/.zfproject.xml </em></strong>another optional solution may be found <a title="Zend Framework tool - project already exists here" href="http://www.danielbyrne.net/2011/02/zend-framework-tool-project-already-exists-here/" target="_blank">here</a></li>
	<li>Till now we have a working project, as you may see it on your webserver path, e.g: <em><strong>http://localhost/skoproject/
<a href="http://koshaked.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/zendframeworkprojectwelcome.png"><img class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-58" title="zendframeworkprojectwelcome" src="http://koshaked.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/zendframeworkprojectwelcome.png?w=300" alt="Zend Framework - Welcome screen" width="300" height="203" /></a> </strong></em></li>
</ol>
Next, we will create our inside project, including Models, Controllers, Modules and everything that we need for understanding how Zend framework works.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>53</wp:post_id>

		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>

		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>

		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>

		</wp:postmeta>

		<wp:meta_key>tagazine-media</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:7:{s:7:"primary";s:75:"http://koshaked.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/zendframeworkprojectwelcome.png";s:6:"images";a:2:{s:73:"http://koshaked.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/zfcreateprojectexisterror.png";a:6:{s:8:"file_url";s:73:"http://koshaked.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/zfcreateprojectexisterror.png";s:5:"width";s:3:"584";s:6:"height";s:3:"121";s:4:"type";s:5:"image";s:4:"area";s:5:"70664";s:9:"file_path";s:0:"";}s:75:"http://koshaked.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/zendframeworkprojectwelcome.png";a:6:{s:8:"file_url";s:75:"http://koshaked.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/zendframeworkprojectwelcome.png";s:5:"width";s:3:"645";s:6:"height";s:3:"437";s:4:"type";s:5:"image";s:4:"area";s:6:"281865";s:9:"file_path";s:0:"";}}s:6:"videos";a:0:{}s:11:"image_count";s:1:"2";s:6:"author";s:8:"22477560";s:7:"blog_id";s:8:"21988844";s:9:"mod_stamp";s:19:"2011-05-18 07:12:47";}]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
